poem:
**Self-Reflection in the House**

In chambers of echo, where words weave and twist,  
hearts thud with the weight of their own plotted lists.  
Mirror-eyed MPs, in soliloquy grand,  
hold worlds on their tongues, in the palm of one hand.  
Yet outside their bubble of power and spell,  
the nation's own stories stir, restless to tell.
